alert.note: Alert for Anson; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 09 at 9:47AM EDT until April 10 at 8:48AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Rocky River Near Norwood affecting Stanly and Anson Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rocky River Near Norwood. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Action Stage. The river begins to overflow its banks in some areas upstream of the gage site. At 20.0 feet, Minor flood stage. There is significant overflow into adjacent pasture and lowlands. At 27.0 feet, The parking lot at the Anson County boat access on the will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM EDT Sunday the stage was 26.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 5.8 feet early Friday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Thu Rocky River Norwood 20.0 26.7 Sun 9 am EDT 10.7 7.0 6.2 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1000 PM EDT.
